Comment: The Queen's pawn opening [A40]
Queen's pawn game [A45]. This flexible move is the most common reply for black, as the knight is almost always good on f6.
Queen's pawn game [A50]. If there was a pawn on d5, this would be the queen's gambit, a very popular opening.
The benoni defense [A56], a sharp defense, and a favorite of mine.

Aiming to fianchetto the bishop on the very power, very open long diagonal. [A65]
I play this move to give white a very solid structure and maximum flexibility for his pieces, (black's knight can't harass a bishop on e3, white's knight could potentially get to f2, etc...)
This pin can get nasty fast for black, he must break it immediately.
